page.title: 15Farming:
page.content: Treloweth Farm, St.Erth The farmhouse dates about l72O,this has been estblished since the chimney stack is built from local bricks which were only produced after that date. The farmhouse, once thatched, is a listed property and much photographed - as in the A.A.farmhouse guide. The farm of approximately l8O acres, which was mixed up until some l5 years ago, is given over to Guernsey cow dairy farming, however a few of the cattle are kept for beef.On the farm currently are 3 Guernsey bulls which has meant 23 calves. The tenant farmer and his family have been in the house for three generations from the turn of this century. The farm belongs to Lord St.Levan who owns a good deal of land in the county and elsewhere.
